meanings.definition: Not easily upset or excited; calm and peaceful.
meanings.sent1: The placid lake reflected the clear blue sky.
meanings.sent2: She felt placid as she listened to the soothing music.
meanings.sent3: The placid cat slept peacefully in the warm sun.
meanings.sent4: His placid demeanor calmed the tense atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The placid morning mist enveloped the quiet town in serenity.

meanings.sent3: The ducks glided gracefully across the placid of the river.
meanings.sent4: The placid of the ocean lulled the sailors into a sense of tranquility.
meanings.sent5: The placid of the stream sparkled in the sunlight, inviting us to dip our toes.
